title: My Money: 'I eat biscuits like a naughty schoolboy'
description: Mark Bauwens from France takes us through his week during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: The Kashmiris waiting for their loved ones to come home
description: A year after Indian-administered Kashmir lost its special status, thousands still languish in jail.

title: Letter from Africa: How African generosity dried a teacher's tears
description: Strangers helped a Nigerian teacher, left without money because of coronavirus, get back on his feet.

title: LinkedIn co-founder reveals key secret to success
description: Allen Blue, who co-founded professional network LinkedIn, reveals how start-ups can achieve growth.

title: ‘Why I run with a car tyre on my back’
description: Ben runs in the Peak District to boost his mental health after a suicide attempt two years ago.

title: What is the 'sovereign citizen' movement?
description: Anti-government activists who believe they are immune from the law are a worldwide threat, experts say.

title: Coronavirus: Three Biden claims about Trump fact-checked
description: Joe Biden has made a series of claims about the president's coronavirus response - is he right?

title: Is noise pollution killing whales and dolphins?
description: Dr Maria Morell studies their ears to discover if hearing damage led to their death.

title: Microsoft's TikTok grab: Inspired or naive?
description: High-risk, high-reward - Microsoft has announced it is in negotiations to buy TikTok.

title: Jesus Army abuse 'covered-up by church leaders', report claims
description: An inquiry finds senior members of the now-defunct sect did not take necessary action to stop abuse.

title: Coronavirus economy: 'I'm just looking for whatever I can get'
description: This is what they say it's like to be in your 20s and unemployed during the age of coronavirus.

title: British Vogue September issue: Edward Enninful showcases activists of 'hope'
description: British Vogue's Edward Enninful says it was a "no-brainer" that the September issue would be about activism.

title: Nasa astronaut Bob Behnken describes what it feels like leaving space
description: Nasa astronaut Bob Behnken describes the powerful moment of splashdown.

title: China Uighurs: A model's video gives a rare glimpse inside internment
description: Seven months ago Merdan Ghappar disappeared in Xinjiang. Then his family started getting messages.

title: Medical dream 'in tatters' after results downgraded
description: A straight A pupil from Motherwell believes she was awarded results way beneath predictions because of her school's location.

title: Sony's Spider-Man exclusive sparks backlash
description: The superhero will appear exclusively in the PlayStation version of Marvel's Avengers.

title: Why there’s still a reason to rhyme
description: Poetry will become an optional subject area in GCSE English literature exams next year.

title: Sheffield marriage proposal causes flat fire
description: The luckless lover lit hundreds of candles before leaving to collect his girlfriend.

title: Hurricane Isaias makes landfall in North Carolina
description: Previously downgraded to a storm, Isaias was upgraded to a hurricane hours before making landfall.

title: Spain's embattled ex-King Juan Carlos leaves country
description: His departure comes weeks after the former monarch was linked to a probe into alleged corruption.

title: 'Nobody had to tell me I wasn't going to walk again - I just knew' - Paralympian Carrigill
description: After a car crash 10 years ago left her paralysed, GB wheelchair basketball player Sophie Carrigill looks back on her recovery.

title: Gossip: Can Man City sign Nathan Ake, Ferran Torres, Kalidou Koulibaly & Lionel Messi?
description: BBC Sport's Liam Loftus catches up with Manchester City fan Steve McInerney from fan channel Esteemed Kompany to discuss who Pep Guardiola might want to lure to Etihad Stadium this summer.

title: The Papers: 'Rishi Two Snacks' and Russians 'hacked minister'
description: The papers cover the government meal deal launch and reports of spies in an ex-minister's email.

title: London Olympics 2012: Jessica Ennis-Hill, Greg Rutherford & Mo Farah win gold on Super Saturday
description: Relive the best of the action from Super Saturday at London 2012 as Mo Farah, Jessica Ennis-Hill and Greg Rutherford win three gold medals on an unforgettable day for Team GB.

title: Coronavirus: Millions return to lockdown in Philippines
description: A strict curb on movements has been re-imposed in the capital Manila after a surge in Covid infections.

title: Coronavirus: GCSE students allowed to drop topics in 2021 exams
description: The move allows English and history pupils to focus on reduced content after disruption to lessons.

title: Donald Trump: US Treasury should get cut of TikTok deal
description: The president's comments come after Microsoft said it is in talks to buy the app's US business.

title: Queen in anniversary tribute to British Red Cross
description: The Duchess of Cambridge, whose grandmother was a Red Cross nurse. calls the charity 'inspiring'.

title: Beach SOS saves men stranded on tiny Micronesian island
description: The Micronesian men were spotted by Australian and US aircraft after being reported missing on Saturday.

title: Twitter: Athlete Jimmy Watkins' running music reviews a hit
description: Jimmy Watkins, a record-holding athlete and from a prize-winning band, is combining his hobbies.

title: Testing and tracing 'key to schools returning', scientists say
description: Scientists say the UK test-and-trace scheme is not yet good enough to stop a resurgence of coronavirus.

title: Coronavirus: Drive-through test motorist given parking fine
description: Geoff Pugh received the fine after taking his family to a test site in a shopping centre car park.

title: What's going on with TikTok?
description: Microsoft confirmed it wants to acquire TikTok after President Trump threatened to ban the app.

title: How grades were worked out in Scotland's no-exams year
description: Scotland's class of 2020 get their results, but for the first time they will not be based on exams. So, how have the grades been worked out?

title: Scotland's results day: School pupils get their grades after exam-free year
description: Grades were estimated by teachers after the coronavirus forced exams to be cancelled for the first time.

title: James Lovelock: Gaia theory creator on coronavirus and turning 101
description: British scientist James Lovelock says population growth means something like the virus is "almost inevitable".
